page.title: 06LOCAL HISTORY-GOTHAM CHURCH
page.content:
GOTHAM CHURCH
St Lawrence church is just over eight hundred years old.It stands to the right of the village square.The old graves surround the church but the newer graves are in the cemetery on the other side of the main road.The church is made of stone and an early type of broach spire is believed to be the only one of it's kind in Nottinghamshire. Some architectural changes have been made to the church over the last fourteen years.One major improvement has been made to the west entrance, which was the addition of a tower door and a floor for the bellringing chamber.
